bug.author: henningpeters
bug.description:
Out-of-memory isn't properly handled, see <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/issues/236>#236</denchmark-link> . Error reports include: <denchmark-code>Error in `python': free(): invalid next size (normal): 0x000000000dfff920 *** Aborted (core dumped) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-code>Error in `python': free(): invalid pointer: 0x0000000005fff4a8 *** </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: Thanks. Definitely agree that there's a problem here. Likely candidates are the raw calls to PyMem_Malloc and PyMem_Realloc in thinc. Mostly memory allocation goes via the cymem library, which I believe is checking status codes correctly.
